snippet: The United States government, which spent more than $4 billion in assistance to El Salvador’s military during its civil war, is now working to bring some of the officers to justice.
abstract: United States government, which gave more than $4 billion in assistance to El Salvador's military during its civil war, is now working to bring down some officers it once partnered with; most prominent example of shift is Justice Dept's push to extradite former vice defense min Inocente Orlando Montano Morales linked to 1989 killing of Jesuits.
lead_paragraph: The United States government, which spent more than $4 billion in assistance to El Salvador’s military during its civil war, is now working to bring some of the officers to justice.

headline.main: U.S. Wants Former Salvadoran Ally to Face Justice in 1989 Massacre
headline.print_headline: U.S. Wants Former Salvadoran Ally to Face Justice in 1989 Massacre
